SEARCH
Package players

Interface Player

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
ComputerPlayer, HumanPlayer, NetworkPlayer
public interface Player extends Serializable
The Player interface represents a player in a chess game. This interface defines methods to get and set player attributes, such as color, name, and player type, as well as methods to handle player-specific actions like determining the promotion piece for a pawn. implementation of the interface depends on the type of player.

    • isGoDown

      boolean isGoDown()
      Checks if the player's pieces are moving down the board (towards higher row indices).
      Returns:
      true if the player's pieces are moving down, false otherwise

    • setGoDown

      void setGoDown(boolean goDown)
      Sets the direction of the player's pieces on the board.
      Parameters:
      goDown - true to set the pieces moving down, false otherwise

      Piece getPromotionPiece(Chessboard chessboard)
